intro: Crepis fraasii subsp. fraasii, commonly known as the Fraas's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal rosettes of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a single, terminal head, typical of the Compositae family. It is native to Central Asia and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Crepis genus, with specific adaptations to its arid or semi-arid habitats.
